originalText.text:
A feel like after 15 months of interacting with SAE, I can assure you that 3 stars is all I can offer.  As someone who had experience with DAWs and being a part of shows around NYC, I know for a fact that SAE NYC DOES NOT prepare you for entry level positions in the audio industry. Most of what you learn will be on your own or from fellow students (who tend to know more than the teachers in some / most fields).  Also expect a portion of curriculum to be nixed as you get closer to graduation. And post graduation, expect to be shunned out and forgotten, left to your own devices to find a proper job that you can “fake” your way into because of the lack of experience and knowledge that the school can offer.  Literally my first day as an intern taught me more about gear and a professional standard than SAE did.
If you are completely new to anything audio related: this school may be for you. But if you have access to YouTube or LinkedIn Learning, that’s where most of the content spawns from. Not to say there aren’t great people / teachers / faculty that run the day to day; it just feels like the overarching system is flawed.

originalText.text: Best audio engineering school ever!!! The entire faculty is extremely friendly and genuinely want to see you succeed. As for the teacher's... You can't find anyone better! Their knowledge is next level. Also they know how to connect with their class so the students can have a better experience and are more driven to learn. Thank You to everyone @ S.A.E.!!!

originalText.text:
Saddened to see some people comment the horrible things they did about this school. It was the best decision I ever made! I've been graduated for a week and already been sent 5 job leads a week later. Not only that, but the experience at the school was top notch. Two instructors in particular that were fantastic were Joe Totino and Nathan Rosenberg. They were hands on in their teaching and taught me to figure things out on my own, which I used to struggle with. I am happy to have gone to school here, I met amazing people and got one of kind skills.

If you are unable to get a job finishing SAE after they give you literally EVERY tool you need to nail an interview and land a job in Audio, sorry but SAE is not the problem. Thank you also to Molly and Hilary in the Career Services department for being ROCKSTARS.
